qas.question: What is the name of the largest denomination of Presbyterian church in Vanuatu?
From which country did the Presbyterian Church of Vanuatu originate from?
What is the largest denomination church in Vanuatu?
Missionaries from which country started The Presbyterian Church in Vanuatu?
Which two towns have Presbyterian people, but no churches?
With nearly one third of the population of Vanuatu members of the church, which church is the smallest denomination?
The Province of Sanma is mainly Roman Catholic with what minority?
There are some organized Presbyterian churches but not Presbyterian people where?
Which is the only country in the North Pacific with a large Presbyterian following?
Who is the Vanuatu Christian Council a founding member of?

context: <a0_0><a2_0><b5_0>The Presbyterian Church<b5_0/> in Vanuatu<a2_0/><a0_0/> is the largest denomination in the country, with approximately one-third of the population of Vanuatu members of the church. The PCV was taken to Vanuatu by missionaries from <a1_0><a3_0>Scotland<a3_0/><a1_0/>. The PCV (Presbyterian Church of Vanuatu) is headed by a moderator with offices in Port Vila. The PCV is particularly strong in the provinces of Tafea, Shefa, and Malampa. The Province of Sanma is mainly <b6_0>Presbyterian<b6_0/> with a strong Roman Catholic minority in the Francophone areas of the province. There are some Presbyterian people, but no organised Presbyterian churches in <a4_0><b7_0>Penama and Torba<b7_0/><a4_0/>, both of which are traditionally Anglican. <b8_0>Vanuatu<b8_0/> is the only country in the South Pacific with a significant Presbyterian heritage and membership. <b9_0>The PCV<b9_0/> is a founding member of the Vanuatu Christian Council (VCC). The PCV runs many primary schools and Onesua secondary school. The church is strong in the rural villages.
